Award.AwardTitle: IISA 2018: From Data to Knowledge, Working for a Better World
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports a four day 2018 international conference titled "IISA 2018: From Data to Knowledge, Working for a Better World" which will take place at the University of Florida, Gainesville, Florida, from May 17 - May 20, 2018. This conference will bring together statisticians from diverse areas of statistics/biostatistics, probability and data science in a collaborative setting to discuss and foster the latest developments of statistical theory, methods and tools for making accurate inference from complex and noisy data sources. The grant funding will be used to cover partial costs of a number of doctoral students and young researchers who will present their research at this conference.

The theme of the conference is to discuss and foster the cutting-edge developments of statistical theory, methods and tools for making accurate inference from complex and noisy data sources. Plenary speakers for this conference include Montserrat Fuentes (Virginia Commonwealth University), Hira Koul (Michigan State University), and Cyrus Mehta (Cytel Inc). In addition, seven researchers will be giving Special Invited Talks. A number of junior researchers will be given the opportunity to present in invited sessions. Doctoral students will have an opportunity to give oral presentations on a competitive basic. A student poster competition will also be arranged. For further details, please visit the conference web-site: http://iisa2018.biostat.ufl.edu/.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
1. This grant provide travel support for junior researchers (including graduate students) presenting at IISA 2018 and IISA 2019 international conferences which took place at the University of Florida and the Indian Institutes of Technology, Mumbai, respectively. A total of 48 such participants from US based institutes received partial travel support to attend these important conferences.

2. The junior researchers were given an opportunity to present their work in front of a large international audience.

3. The junior researchers benefited by attending presentations given by leading statisticians in the profession.

4.  The junior researchers also received advanced training by attending the preconference workshops on modern statistical topics.

5.  The junior researchers participated in paper and poster competitions and recognized for the excellences of their work. Such recognitions will be beneficial for their careers.

6. The junior researchers benefited from a panel discussion during IISA 2018 on ?Advancing Career Development through Mentoring, Coaching and Sponsoring? organized and moderated by Dr. Jaya Satagopan. The panelists were Drs. Amanda Golbeck, Ananda Sen, Mariza De Andrade and Amit Bhattacharya. For IISA 2019, the junior researchers attended two panel sessions focusing on statistical leadership, and professional development of statisticians through mentoring. These sessions provide guidance from successful senior leaders on how to make the statistical concepts count and be influential in our organizations in academics, industry and government.
